Input and outputÂ¶

NumPy binary files (NPY, NPZ)Â¶

load(file[,Â mmap_mode,Â allow_pickle,Â â€¦])

Load arrays or pickled objects from .npy, .npz or pickled files.

save(file,Â arr[,Â allow_pickle,Â fix_imports])

Save an array to a binary file in NumPy .npy format.

savez(file,Â \*args,Â \*\*kwds)

Save several arrays into a single file in uncompressed .npz format.

savez_compressed(file,Â \*args,Â \*\*kwds)

Save several arrays into a single file in compressed .npz format.

The format of these binary file types is documented in numpy.lib.format

Text filesÂ¶

Load data from a text file.

Save an array to a text file.

genfromtxt(fname[,Â dtype,Â comments,Â â€¦])

Load data from a text file, with missing values handled as specified.

fromregex(file,Â regexp,Â dtype[,Â encoding])

Construct an array from a text file, using regular expression parsing.

fromstring(string[,Â dtype,Â count,Â sep])

A new 1-D array initialized from text data in a string.

ndarray.tofile(fid[,Â sep,Â format])

Write array to a file as text or binary (default).

ndarray.tolist()

Return the array as a (possibly nested) list.

Raw binary filesÂ¶

Construct an array from data in a text or binary file.

ndarray.tofile(fid[,Â sep,Â format])

Memory mapping filesÂ¶

memmap

Create a memory-map to an array stored in a binary file on disk.

Base-n representationsÂ¶
